page.title: 18Smarden West - Leisure
page.content: In this rural area where most houses have at least a small plot of land, gardening is a popular hobby and often leads to bee-keeping, wine or cider making. The river encourages fishing, and the attractive landscape amateur artists and photographers. People with small paddocks keep a few sheep and spinning, weaving and knitting follow. Some ladies spend happy hours making tapestry kneelers for the church and others use their skills in dressmaking. Walking, jogging, cycling and horse riding are also popular. On the farms shooting keeps down wood pigeons and rabbits; clay pigeon shooting is practised and one local man is a national champion shot. Cricket and tennis in summer and football and hockey in winter are the main sports available in the village.
